job_tasks.phrase: DataOps Engineer
job_tasks.justification: The job title itself indicates a focus on the operational aspects of data management and pipelines, aligning with the definition of MLOps/DataOps.

job_tasks.phrase: help R&D manage large data-sets of audio-video data
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the operational support for managing large datasets, which is a core aspect of MLOps/DataOps.

job_tasks.phrase: set up a world class data function, managing a lake with PB scale data and building complex audio/visual data pipelines
job_tasks.justification: Setting up data functions, managing data lakes, and building data pipelines are all key responsibilities within MLOps/DataOps.

job_tasks.phrase: streamline our ML development process with access to large scale datasets
job_tasks.justification: Streamlining the ML development process through data management falls under the operational umbrella of MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: help set up our audio-video data pipeline for the Video team and our speech data pipeline for the Voice team
job_tasks.justification: Setting up specific data pipelines for ML teams is a direct MLOps responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Data Ops for data management, versioning, usage tracking, logging.
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly lists core DataOps responsibilities: management, versioning, tracking, and logging.

job_tasks.phrase: Setup of a data-lake and data transform pipelines for large scale audio-visual datasets.
job_tasks.justification: Setting up data lakes and transformation pipelines is a fundamental MLOps/DataOps task.

job_tasks.phrase: Integration of 3d party annotation services for continuous data annotation and active learning.
job_tasks.justification: Integrating services for data annotation and active learning is part of managing the data lifecycle for ML, fitting into MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Setup of metadata stores and APIs to access data-sets on demand for ML training.
job_tasks.justification: Setting up infrastructure for data access and metadata management is an MLOps function.

job_tasks.phrase: Support for data streaming to train large models.
job_tasks.justification: Supporting data streaming for model training is an operational task related to data pipelines.

job_tasks.phrase: Data pipelines - deploy custom ML data transformations, working with our ML team.
job_tasks.justification: Deploying data transformation pipelines for ML is a core MLOps activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Data access - create transient data-sets on demand to support ML model training.
job_tasks.justification: Managing data access and creating datasets for training are operational tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Data tracking - usage tracking and monitoring across all data sources.
job_tasks.justification: Data tracking and monitoring are essential components of MLOps for managing data lifecycle and usage.

job_tasks.phrase: Establish the workflow for continual data delivery and annotation.
job_tasks.justification: Establishing workflows for data delivery and annotation is a key responsibility in managing data pipelines and MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: help R&D manage large data-sets of audio-video data at Synthesia.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates supporting the R&D department, implying an understanding of their needs and how data management contributes to their goals.

job_tasks.phrase: supporting 7+ teams developing cutting edge solutions in generative video synthesis.
job_tasks.justification: Understanding the needs of multiple development teams and the context of 'generative video synthesis' shows business and strategic alignment.

job_tasks.phrase: make data consumption simple.
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on simplifying data consumption for users (ML teams) demonstrates an understanding of user needs and business value.

job_tasks.phrase: super-charge our research.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase clearly links the role's activities to the broader goal of enhancing research, demonstrating business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: streamline our ML development process
job_tasks.justification: Streamlining processes directly relates to improving efficiency and achieving business objectives within the ML development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: working with our ML team.
job_tasks.justification: Collaboration with the ML team implies understanding their requirements and contributing to their business objectives.

soft_skills.phrase: working alongside our Senior DataOps Engineer
soft_skills.justification: Indicates collaboration with a senior team member.
Explicitly states collaboration with another team.
The word 'help' suggests taking initiative and ownership of tasks to support R&D.

soft_skills.phrase: set up a world class data function
soft_skills.justification: Setting up a 'world class' function implies taking ownership and driving innovation in data operations.
Building complex pipelines suggests taking ownership of significant technical components.
This phrase implies a proactive and innovative approach to significantly improve research outcomes.
Streamlining a process indicates taking ownership to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Deploying custom transformations suggests taking ownership of the development and implementation process.
Creating datasets on demand implies taking initiative and ownership to meet specific needs.

soft_skills.phrase: Establish the workflow for continual data delivery and annotation.
soft_skills.justification: Establishing workflows indicates taking ownership and driving process improvements.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on DataOps and MLOps tasks, such as managing large datasets, building data pipelines, setting up data lakes, and ensuring data access for ML training. These tasks fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), specifically 1.A.2 Operations & MLOps (LLMOps). While the role supports teams developing 'cutting edge solutions in generative video synthesis' and mentions 'large models', the core responsibilities are operational and infrastructural, rather than directly developing or fine-tuning AI models (Macro-Category B). There is no mention of specific GenAI tasks like prompt engineering, RAG, or model development itself. Therefore, the role is best classified as an AI-Adjacent Software Engineer, as it builds and maintains the essential data infrastructure that supports AI/ML development, but does not directly engage in the AI model creation or specialization.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the responsibilities, which are consistently focused on data operations and infrastructure for ML teams. The distinction between operational tasks (Category A) and model development tasks (Category B) is evident, allowing for a confident profile assignment.
